documents.document: @KevinMFeeney I made that Domitian argument in an essay! Negative views are all elite.
@KevinMFeeney yeah, you're right. The reality TV star stuff fits with Nero. Hope he doesn't kick Melania to death.
But comparing Trump to Augustus is wrong. He's more of a Domitian.
Lex Julia de maritandis ordinibus! He'll soon be claiming direct lineage to goddess Venus, building a mausoleum & e… https://t.co/O7SZhlCPjl
Note UKIP weren't campaigning for 2nd ref on electoral reform. They wanted it enforced on people who had explicitly voted for status quo.
Farage "defying the will of the people" by pushing for electoral reform after resounding rejection in 2011 ref https://t.co/bYY3ZHO5v2
@cpechet @KellyannePolls Trump women aren't a diverse crowd. They have to conform to v specific stereotypes https://t.co/DTtSCA3g19
There isn't a more textbook example of a woman hater than Milo. Well, perhaps Trump & Bannon.
Trump is defending a man who once said women should be especially scared of sexbots as men would have no need for them anymore.
@BenSaund he truly is. He's incapable of sound judgement or leadership. Labour are becoming irrelevant
@Ronniegeorge deleted last tweets. Pls take my word for it I know this stuff for a fact.
@Ronniegeorge I will do. But I promise you, project to move jobs began implementation phase on day May ruled out SM membership.
@BenSaund and Smith has shown himself to be far more in line with Labour voters & possessed of a backbone.
@Ronniegeorge if you want sustainable business model you do need passporting. It's kind of an area of expertise in my household.
@BenSaund but clearly Labour leadership was always Leave.
@BenSaund sure. I think Labour leadership position is v odd. Corbyn won't win Leave voters & so many Labour constituencies were Remain.
@Ronniegeorge that's true, it could but at least 1 of biggest banks has given up on passporting & is now planning job moves.
@Ronniegeorge it won't. Govt aren't even attempting to keep passporting. Hence banks are now working plans to move staff.
@BenSaund my guy has purely voted with Labour leadership. Despite being v vocal about hard Brexit being disastrous.
@Ronniegeorge I wish there wasn't evidence of it. Unfortunately I know first hand that there is.
@BenSaund it's also voting against his own beliefs that gets me. Feels like representative democracy gone badly awry.
It doesn't feel very democratic for my MP to vote against his own beliefs & the constituency vote. What a mess.
Hard Brexit will definitely damage job prospects in our constituency as so many depend on financial services for work.
My constituency voted Remain. My MP believes hard Brexit will damage Britain but voted to allow govt to proceed with it without hindrance.
These people are not well https://t.co/xCagbQjYpe
@John_J_C_Moss even with advantageous US deal leaving CU makes only ltd sense. RoW FTAs will never replace EU trade.
@John_J_C_Moss and there's zero need to acquiesce to demands for a very early state visit
@John_J_C_Moss yes. If he really isn't our 1 & only then UK having other pressing priorities would be fine.
@John_J_C_Moss holding the hand of a self avowed sex pest. Yeah, we're really keeping a dignified & prudent distance.
@John_J_C_Moss only those deeply emotionally invested in Brexit & the Tories could deny it. Hasty US trip, unprecedented state visit offer.
Malcolm Turnbull stood up to a bully. Theresa May held the bully's hand & offered him Britain on a plate.
@mcdonnelljp it becomes difficult if Trump targets those countries specifically. He's already going for Germany.
Another reason why supine UK making Brexit all about the US is imprudent now: it's not just EU states we'll alienate https://t.co/TuOhrVaBLv
@mcdonnelljp I sincerely hope so. Setting ourselves belligerently against our closest neighbours to ally with Trump seems madness.
@mcdonnelljp it's unfathomable. Had enough MPs held back govt from triggering article 50 they could've forced a softer Brexit.
Argument it's anti democratic to vote against triggering article 50 while govt intent on 1 spectacularly onerous type of Brexit is poppycock
@SiUttley it's speed with which the self styled liberal Leavers have abandoned any pretence at liberalism that shocks. Save the odd 1 or 2.
@Rachel_Moses_ yep, it's why they wouldn't rule it out & why Remainers said they were lying in keeping it in the mix. They were!
In other news: I'm on some strong painkillers after someone skied over my face. So apologies for the over feistiness. Pain & painkillers.
@SiUttley nope. Not a shred. They've got phoney excuses growing out of their phoney excuses.
I remember when they told us we could be like good ole neutral Switzerland or Norway. Those were the days. Fucking liars.
If Brexit is so dependent on hitching your wagon to that evil man there's a big chance it was the mother of all stupid ideas.
Right, see that, Trump fans? That's where it takes you. Down in the hole with those seeking to minimise the anti semitism of the Holocaust.
@jennywhojenny @shakeys7 it dates from 2015 apparently but it shows exactly the spirit in which Trump rise to power has been conducted.
"Get out of my country" "I'm a US citizen" America is truly fucked & Brits excusing this make me sick https://t.co/BVRSs4Wxhc
@guy_herbert but pretending to not be. Just rationalists.
@SarahKate26 window onto Douglas' manly psyche.
I imagine Douglas will spend the next 4 yrs engaged in the manly pursuit of equivocating for racist sex pests. Grr. Manly.
Best bit in this straw man littered piece is the anti woman kicker at the end. Vagina hats, no less https://t.co/mtU4TFQxYS
@renieanjeh she's totally at odds with a London constituency that's for sure.
@renieanjeh tricky. Corbyn is an absolute shocker but Hoey is nearly as ideologically nuts.
@renieanjeh Hoey belongs in UKIP. Soubs is a proper centrist.
Trump clearly plans to use deeply privileged access to our monarch to legitimise himself. It's why he wants it so soon. We will rue it.
Remember, Brexit didn't have to become inextricably linked to a historically unpopular leader engaged in flouting his own constitution.
Brexiteers talk of freedom. Anointing an *at best* deeply divisive POTUS with unprecedented haste *at his demand* isn't freedom.
"Don't insult Trump! Brit jobs depend on it!" say people who have made a sport of insulting our most important trading partners for years.
@dhelme570 I'm sure she can. It's case of whether we want her to.
@Rachel_Moses_ I imagine he was more discerning!! But yeah, he so could have.
@GazTheJourno organising perhaps but not signing. They were available at places people went regularly, like church.
Petitions forced the ban of UK participation in the slave trade & slavery. Take it you wouldn't have signed https://t.co/CZGlImGBFa
Alright, Oswald. https://t.co/qkUP5im4NK
If May does force a state visit on the Royal family Philip should bowl up to Trump & claim he could've had his mum. See how he likes it.
Forcing our future king to entertain a man who's said disgusting things about his wife & late mother is repellent. True patriots oppose.
I love how what the British people think matters more than anything right up until it means fuck all https://t.co/MOZtZlIw2A
@MPSWestminster proud of all involved, inc obvs you guys for good policing.
@TillyKlein probably. Still smells bad in the circs.
@EconvaincuU @EmmanuelMacron @lepen oh look. One of Putin's trolls.
No. This isn't "going global". It's clinging to an outdated alliance of "White Dominions". But only the very whites… https://t.co/pejD51ve0e
@sassycassyL that is a truly excellent squirrel
@ajjolley @Medium it's not like Bannon hasn't said tearing the establishment down isn't his express intent.
@SteveKomarnycky it's awful. West's cowardice or outright support for Putin is shameful.
@ajjolley how America has fallen.
@PGBBNS if Macron wins in France I'm off to Paris. If not I may join you in Dublin.
Putin took power on back of a terror attack on his own people & you want to "normalise relations" with him. You thick cunt @realDonaldTrump
Inc Putin who has killed more civilians than ISIS in Syria & responsible highest fatality terrorist attack in Europ… https://t.co/Q1HlDy5jWv
@PGBBNS crikey. That would be truly nuts.
@CintaArsenal couldn't disagree more strongly. Nationality should never trump skills & experience. Best person for the job.
It's not like he didn't make it crystal clear #makeamericashitagain https://t.co/hT8wEqVKKV https://t.co/3vu9UaYaXk
And here comes Steve Bannon's white nationalism, folks https://t.co/QdmQHVG7ok
@guy_herbert exactly the same! Same attitudes to women too.
@guy_herbert same. These are the people who think "Merkel has ruined Germany" & all Muslims are to be suspected.
@TheOncoming I think we'd still be going for a deal & leaving CU just without the cosying up to an aspiring despot issues.
@guy_herbert yes. It shows up the extent of the irrational fear of the EU & all its institutions.
UK being forced to align with countries who lack our commitment to human rights at expense of those who do share it is madness.
Inflexibility in face of rapidly changing geopolitics smacks of zealotry. Case for leaving customs union may disappear.
Much of UK backing for Trump comes from ideological commitment to hard Brexit. Tying ourselves to Trump to justify leaving CU always unwise.
@SiUttley I think they actively enjoy it. Small men & women needing to feel powerful over others.
@SiUttley I think it might be worse than sociopathy. Next stop: making lampshades out of human skin.
What the living fuck is wrong with these people? How can terrifying your opponents be the political end game? Psych… https://t.co/UhT4j4UBlo
@LeftOverForEver laughable. Seriously.
@LeftOverForEver Islamic terrorism isn't even close to the threat Irish republican terrorism was to Britain. Nowhere near.
@LeftOverForEver this isn't even close to being true. Those killed & displaced by Assad massively dwarfs those killed & displaced by IS.
@LeftOverForEver right, so we're to blame for all evils committed by all Britons? Why are all Muslims all responsible for actions of tiny %?
@LeftOverForEver without "huffing & puffing" there would never have been most human progress. But sneer all you want.
@LeftOverForEver our economic weakness is self inflicted. Hence having to cosy up to a proto fascist.
@LeftOverForEver it isn't about "the left". It's about the leader of the free world victimising the innocent & embracing real evil.
@LeftOverForEver it's far from claptrap. What's claptrap is directing people's ire at at ordinary Muslims to distract from the real danger.
@LeftOverForEver but by all means equivocate for perpetrators of genocide.
@LeftOverForEver Putin's support for Assad predates Cameron's attempts at action. Miliband is a coward. Putin is a war criminal.
@LeftOverForEver it's specifically a vindictive muscle flex. It will help no-one & harm many.
